block.p: Malena Knopf Mathiesen, the daughter of Irmgard Mathiesen of Jyderup, Denmark, and the late Aksel H. Mathiesen, was married yesterday to David Michael Belafonte, the son of the singer Harry Belafonte and Julie Belafonte of New York. David N. Dinkins, the former mayor of New York, officiated at the Bryant Park Grill.

Mrs. Belafonte, 28, is a fashion model and the host of ''The Malena Mathiesen Special,'' a celebrity profile program shown four times a year on Scandinavian television. Her mother, a retired recorder soloist, was a professor of music at the Danish Royal Conservatory in Copenhagen. The bride's father was a composer and conductor with Concentus Musicus of Denmark, an ensemble based in Copenhagen.

Mrs. Belafonte, 28, is a fashion model and the host of ''The Malena Mathiesen Special,'' a celebrity profile program shown four times a year on Scandinavian television. Her mother, a retired recorder soloist, was a professor of music at the Danish Royal Conservatory in Copenhagen. The bride's father was a composer and conductor with Concentus Musicus of Denmark, an ensemble based in Copenhagen.

Mr. Belafonte, 43, is the vice president of Belafonte Enterprises, a New York company founded by his father, which encompasses Niger Records, three music publishing units and Harbel Productions, a television and film company. The bridegroom received a certificate in sound engineering from the Institute of Audio Research in Manhattan. His mother, a former principal dancer with the Katherine Dunham Dance Company, is an owner of Six-Sept, a New York antiques shop specializing in English collectibles.
